alert.note: Alert for Ashe; Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wilkes, southeastern Watauga and southeastern Ashe Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel Springs to Darby. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glendale Springs... Wilbar... Deep Gap... Mc Grady... Darby... Fleetwood... and Idlewild. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
